_header: Sirs a miracle or two I shall you tell
_description: Two miracles of the Virgin Mary: (I) Knight saved by Two Words (104 lines); (2) Knight who said five Aves daily (238 lines) — in couplets

BodTan407.First Lines:
SErys a merakyl or to I schal ȝou telleThat for our ladyis
                    loue somtyme be felle…
BodTan407.Last Lines:
…To þat plas bryng vs cryst god and manThrow þe
                    preyer of oure lady & of sent Anne
BodTan407.Editions:
Tryon,  Ruth Wilson. 
             “Miracles of Our Lady in Middle English Verse.” 
             PMLA
         38 (1923): 308-81: 374-86.
Louis,  Cameron,
                        ed.  
             The Commonplace Book of Robert Reynes of Acle: an edition of Tanner MS
                407.
         New York: Garland, 1980: 228-30.
